instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PLT_RST_L: What is PLT_RST_L? This is an abbreviation of “PLT_RESET_L” – when you see “PLT_RST_L", assume the person meant to type PLT_RESET_L.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Is my CPU really dead?
threads.message: So I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that I pulled out of my "rabbit hole" box. I'm pretty sure it just needed a new <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> and some solder mask repair. So I put a new <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> but not it draws a steady 450mA  but no chime amd no image. The only corrosion found was in the area of <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>. Now I am stuck with an LB that doesn't post. I checked the G3H rails which are present, <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> is there, RTC is 3.3V, <SIGNAL>PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL> is 3.3V. Not sure what to check next. I get a pulse on PIN 6 of <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> when first turning on the LB but when I plug a USB stick into the USB port, It is just a solid light, no blinking.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Is my CPU really dead?
threads.message:
Did you check USB activity and LCD image, before start to work on backlight area?

Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces.
Be sure J6100 is clean and no corrosion under its pins.

Try full known good working BIOS, clean ME.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Is my CPU really dead?
threads.message: Yeah I tested the board and can confirm it was only a backlight issue before I changed <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>. I'll have to to see if I can get someone to clean the ME for me. I'll try with my MEDUSA first. the last time I tried it didn't work.
